derivation.yuyuan_name: late 19th cent.: gel from gel; the variant jell is a back-formation from jelly
late 19th cent.: supressed?> representing a pronunciation

entry.def: If people gel with each other, or if two groups of people gel, they work well together because their skills and personalities fit together well.

example.ex: They have gelled very well with the rest of the side...
example.tran: 他们跟另一方的其他人合作得十分愉快。

example.ex: There were signs on Saturday that the team is starting to gel at last...
example.tran: 周六有迹象表明这支队伍终于开始团结作战了。

entry.tran: （模糊的轮廓、想法、创作）变得更清楚，变得更明确
entry.def: If a vague shape, thought, or creation gels, it becomes clearer or more definite.

example.ex: Even if her interpretation has not yet gelled into a satisfying whole, she displays real musicianship...
example.tran: 虽然她的演绎在整体上还不太令人满意，但她表现出了真正的音乐才华。

example.ex: It was not until 1974 that his ability to write gelled again.
example.tran: 直到1974年，他的写作才华才又得以发挥。

entry.def: Gel is a thick jelly-like substance, especially one used to keep your hair in a particular style.

means.word_mean: 1. a colloid in a more solid form than a sol
2. a thin translucent membrane used over stage lights for color effects
